message: The problem with the stats is that Bernie's ground game usually doesn't start picking up steam until the week before the primary. It isn't until then that his poll numbers start to rise, and they rise quickly. Bernie has consistently done better than polling shows he should in nearly every state up to this point. He far exceeded polls this past weekend. He did better than polls suggested he would in Arizona, despite the fiasco that occurred in that state, as well as in Utah and Idaho. He's been outperforming polls this entire election, so don't count him out yet.
